author: Shalini Nagarajan
title: China's economy suffered its first contraction in over 40 years, shrinking 7% in an 'extraordinary shock' to the global economy
description: China's economy fell by 6.8% in the first three months of 2020, signalling gloom for the country severely impacted by the coronavirus that emerged in its central city of Wuhan and spread to the rest of the world. China's National Bureau of Statistics released…
content:
China's economy shrank for the first time in almost half a century in the first three months of 2020 as production and spending were frozen by the country's coronavirus lockdown.
The National Bureau of Statistics reported on Friday that gross domestic produc… [+2766 chars]
